IntersectWithLine
bool IntersectWithLine(
Vector2 &p0,
Vector2 &p1,
RayIntersect2 *pIntersectInfo
)

Calculates the intersection of a 2D ray with a line.

    R.pos + R.dir * t = p0 + (p1 - p0) * u
taking cross product of R.dir with both sides gives:
    (R.pos + R.dir * t) x R.dir = (p0 + (p1 - p0) * u) x R.dir
    ((p1 - p0) * u x R.dir) = (R.pos - p0) x R.dir
given that (R.dir * t) x R.dir == 0
    u = ((R.pos - p0) x R.dir) / ((p1 - p0)x R.dir)
    t = -(R.pos - p0) x(p1 - p0) / (-(p1 - p0) xR.dir)
Parameters
p0
Vector2&

start of line segment

p1
Vector2&

end of line segment

pIntersectInfo
RayIntersect2*

Returns intersection results

Returns

Returns true if ray intersects line. False otherwise.

Intersect
bool Intersect(
float bottomRadius,
float topRadius,
float height,
Matrix4x4 *pInvTm,
RayIntersect3 *pIntersectInfo
)

Calculates intersection of a ray with a cone

Calculates the intersection of a ray with a cone. The cone is defined by a top and bottom radius (which maybe something other than 0.0f and 1.0f resulting in a tapered cone). The equation for the cone is:

b = bottom radius
t = top radius
h = height of cone
x^2 + y^2 = (((z + 1) * t - (z - 1) * b) / 2)^2
Parameters
bottomRadius
float

Radius of the bottom of the cone

topRadius
float

Radius of the top of the cone

height
float

Height of cone

pInvTm
Matrix4x4*

Matrix to convert from ray's coordinate space to unit space (generally world=>object)

pIntersectInfo
RayIntersect3*

Returns the interesection info. Maybe nullptr.

Returns

True if ray intersects cone. False otherwise.
